tracks.name: Martin Roth — Deep Style (Original Mix)
tracks.notes: Opener. 2A bridge at bar 59, 12A groove kicks in at bar 64. Stretch to 123 to meet Foss.

tracks.name: Marsh feat. Mimi Page — Foss
tracks.notes: No stretch needed. Opens quietly in 6A.

tracks.name: Alone (Extended Mix)
tracks.notes: Enters in 6A as Foss fades. Bassline drop at bar 56.

tracks.name: Kasablanca — Am I Dreaming?
tracks.notes: Clean cut entry. Vocal hit at ~bar 7 resets attention. Short track.

tracks.name: Orbital — Otoño
tracks.notes: Skip first 8 bars (stylistically odd). Track starts at bar 9.

tracks.name: Lady Danger (Mixed)
tracks.notes: 40 bars of intro runway before first structural event.

tracks.name: You Are Sleeping (PQM Meets Luke Chable Vocal Pass)
tracks.notes: Enter at bar 65 (1A melodic section). Percussive intro skipped. Must be out by bar 289.

tracks.name: Quivver — Brothers & Sisters (Original Mix)
tracks.notes: 1A->1A perfect harmonic match with You Are Sleeping.

tracks.name: Below The Belt (Chris Micali Remix)
tracks.notes: Percussive intro with playful bass. 1A intro and 1A outro.

tracks.name: Ronski Speed & Syntrobic feat. Renee Stahl — Pink Skye
tracks.notes: HARD transition from Below The Belt. EQ strategy: cut BTB mids/highs.

tracks.name: LTN — Daylight (Original Mix)
tracks.notes: Closer. 9A->8B comfortable overlap. Let it play out.

transitions.notes: Short crossfade or clean cut. Deep Style stretched to 123 for smooth handoff.
Long energy crossfade. Foss (3A) overlaps Alone (6A) — 5/7 shared notes. Foss fades naturally as Alone builds.
BPM jump 123->126. Alone rides 9B outro to silence, Am I Dreaming vocal resets.
Both 126 BPM. 7A->4B clean cut, no overlap to clash.
4B->2A, 5/7 notes. Lady Danger has 40 bars of intro runway.
Percussive bridge. Key clash (2A vs 8A) doesn't matter — all beats. BPM jump 126->129.
1A->1A perfect harmonic match. 89 bars of runway.
1A->1A at the edges. Below The Belt's percussive intro overlaps well.
HARD transition. Cut BTB mids/highs, let Ronski's percussion slide in. Short overlap.
